content:
by Rob Mortell Staff ReporterOctober  

Easterns mens soccer team is now in a tie for fifth in the Summit League standings PERIOD



If the season were to end today the Panthers would miss the postseason tournament as the top four teams make it PERIOD

Eastern has tailed four points one win and one tie and trails leagueleading Western Illinois by five points PERIOD

The Panthers and Oral Roberts are tied in the fifth spot trailing Indiana UniversityPurdue University at Indianapolis and the University of Missouri at Kansas City by two points PERIOD Eastern also trails Indiana UniversityPurdue University at Fort Wayne by one point PERIOD

The Panthers have two more Summit League matches against Oakland and IPFW meaning they have a chance at six more points and a spot in the tournament PERIOD

Summit League

players of the week

IUPUI freshman forward Sam Fuller earns this weeks offensive player of the week award for his performances against IPFW and Cleveland State PERIOD

Fuller connected on goals that gave his team the win in both games PERIOD Against Cleveland State he scored the matchs lone goal giving IUPUI a  win PERIOD Against IPFW Fuller had an early assist but it was his goal in the one hundred and fourth minute that vaulted his team to victory in overtime PERIOD

Fuller has four goals this season all of which were gamewinners PERIOD This is also the first time he earned the Summit League offensive player of the week award PERIOD

Western Illinois goalkeeper Andy Ryan earns his fourth career defensive player of the week award after shutting out Oakland PERIOD

Ryan made five saves in the game and the win also clinched a spot in the Summit League tournament PERIOD He also leads the conference with seven shutouts this season PERIOD

Around the Summit League

Western Illinois defeated Oakland  securing a spot in the Summit League tournament PERIOD

The Leathernecks scored early when Nathan Bruinsma kicked in a goal in the twenty-second minute PERIOD The goal was Bruinsmas third of the season PERIOD

The win improves Westerns record to  overall and  in Summit League play while Oakland falls to  overall and  in conference PERIOD

In other Summit League action Oral Roberts and the UMKC played to a  tie PERIOD

The match was delayed  minutes due to inclement weather however even after the delay the entire match could not be played PERIOD The head referee called the match in the seventy-first minute due to lightning PERIOD

Oral Roberts record now stands at  overall and  in the Summit League while UMKCs record stands at  and  in conference PERIOD
